feed.title: The Meshinchi Lab
feed.subtitle: Welcome to the Meshinchi Lab at Fred Hutch. Led by Soheil Meshinchi, M.D., Ph.D., our research laboratory is studying genomic expression of acute myeloid leukemia-restricted targets on the cell surface that are ideal for immunotherapeutic targeting with chimeric antigen receptor T-cell (CAR T) therapies, as well as identifying and validating target genes for further immunotherapy development.

entry.title: Computational Work in The Meshinchi Lab

link.title: Computational Work in The Meshinchi Lab

entry.content:
The field of biology is firmly in the age of big data. The Meshinchi lab is only an exception in that we have even more data than nearly another other pediatric AML researchers on earth. This makes employing computational skills a critical part of nearly any research we undertake.

To learn more about what the Meshinchi Lab is working on, check out our github
entry.summary: The field of biology is firmly in the age of big data. The Meshinchi lab is only an exception in that we have even more data than nearly another other pediatric AML researchers on earth. This makes employing computational skills a critical part of nearly any research we undertake.
